snippet.textDisplay: Tbh i prefer Dabi to be an illegitimate child of Endeavor, born roughly the same time as Natsuo. Endeavor disillusioned by the fact that his wife Rei has failed giving him his "masterpiece" twice in a row, decides to use his connections to cheat on his wife with another fire quirk user in order to see the results (would doubling the quirks effectiveness but also doubling its weakness be enough to become no. 1)  and gives him an extra insurance plan in case a pregnant Rei fails him a third time. At first, Endeavor monetarily supports Dabi and his mother discretely while monitoring Dabi's life from a far to see if he's worthy to become his successor, but after Shoto's quirk manifested and becomes Endeavor's long awaited successor, Endeavor stops supporting his illegitimate child and his mistress. Angered by Endeavor just throwing them away like toys, they approach Endeavor to which he responds by telling them he finally has a successor worthy of his time and calls them failures; Dabi for being too weak to be of any use to Endeavor and Dabi's mom for failing in her one and only chance to give him his successor and wasting his time and money.  What once was a relatively happy life, became a nightmare for Dabi and his mother who has to fend for themselves now that the father, whom Dabi had never met, abandoned them. This would explain why Dabi idolizes Stain's ideology of False Heroes, why he probably hates Endeavor and has disdain for the rest of his family,  and why he accentuates the Todoroki instead of just calling him Shoto during the training camp arc.
snippet.textOriginal: Tbh i prefer Dabi to be an illegitimate child of Endeavor, born roughly the same time as Natsuo. Endeavor disillusioned by the fact that his wife Rei has failed giving him his "masterpiece" twice in a row, decides to use his connections to cheat on his wife with another fire quirk user in order to see the results (would doubling the quirks effectiveness but also doubling its weakness be enough to become no. 1)  and gives him an extra insurance plan in case a pregnant Rei fails him a third time. At first, Endeavor monetarily supports Dabi and his mother discretely while monitoring Dabi's life from a far to see if he's worthy to become his successor, but after Shoto's quirk manifested and becomes Endeavor's long awaited successor, Endeavor stops supporting his illegitimate child and his mistress. Angered by Endeavor just throwing them away like toys, they approach Endeavor to which he responds by telling them he finally has a successor worthy of his time and calls them failures; Dabi for being too weak to be of any use to Endeavor and Dabi's mom for failing in her one and only chance to give him his successor and wasting his time and money.  What once was a relatively happy life, became a nightmare for Dabi and his mother who has to fend for themselves now that the father, whom Dabi had never met, abandoned them. This would explain why Dabi idolizes Stain's ideology of False Heroes, why he probably hates Endeavor and has disdain for the rest of his family,  and why he accentuates the Todoroki instead of just calling him Shoto during the training camp arc.

snippet.textDisplay: If Dabi is really Touya then he wouldn't be the same age as Hawks. Cuz Endeavour has children only because he wanted someone to beat All Might so he had to wait until each child reaches 4 years old to get their quirks then he would make another child. So if Touya really is the oldest son, then he would be at least 28 counting from Shoto's age. Unless Enji just figured out each quirks from the color of his kids' hairs then 🤷

snippet.textDisplay:
I love Horikoshi but the teasing over the FACT that Dabi is Toya Todoroki has been so long drawn out that I wonder if it's meant to make us frustrated with the character? Does he want us to see Dabi in this light of "Shut up and grow up you fuckin' crybaby bitch. You aren't endgame worthy, your backstory can't be any sadder than anyone else. You're a nobody and I don't care that you're Toya Todoroki."


Are we supposed to be laughing at how narcissistic he is, or are we supposed to take him seriously?
snippet.textOriginal:
I love Horikoshi but the teasing over the FACT that Dabi is Toya Todoroki has been so long drawn out that I wonder if it's meant to make us frustrated with the character?  Does he want us to see Dabi in this light of "Shut up and grow up you fuckin' crybaby bitch.  You aren't endgame worthy, your backstory can't be any sadder than anyone else.  You're a nobody and I don't care that you're Toya Todoroki."


Are we supposed to be laughing at how narcissistic he is, or are we supposed to take him seriously?

snippet.textDisplay: To be fair to Dabi, it took a LONG time to get Shigaraki’s backstory as well, and he was introduced about fifty chapters before Dabi. So, it makes sense that Dabi’s backstory should come a while after Shigaraki’s backstory. Although we did have more confirmed bits and pieces about Shigaraki before his full backstory, so there’s that.

snippet.textDisplay: If Dabi’s real name somehow isn’t Touya Todoroki, then it’s very much possible that Dabi at one point looked up to Endeavor. Maybe something happened that made Dabi realize how crappy of a hero Endeavor was, and after hearing about stain, he adopts Stains ideology, and his goal is kill Endeavor to remove a hero that stain and himself likely did not appreciate.
snippet.textOriginal: If Dabi’s real name somehow isn’t Touya Todoroki, then it’s very much possible that Dabi at one point looked up to Endeavor. Maybe something happened that made Dabi realize how crappy of a hero Endeavor was, and after hearing about stain, he adopts Stains ideology, and his goal is kill Endeavor to remove a hero that stain and himself likely did not appreciate.
